biography.summary: Bernard Sanders is the senior United States Senator from Vermont, a founder of the progressive movement in national politics, and an advocate for universal healthcare, climate action, and economic reform.
biography.early_life: Born September 8, 1941, in New York City, Sanders attended Brooklyn College and the University of Chicago before engaging in local politics in Vermont and later national service.
biography.education: Attended Brooklyn College (CUNY) and studied at the University of Chicago; pursued public policy and economics as part of his political work.
biography.career: Mayor of Burlington (1981-1989); U.S. Representative (1991-2007); U.S. Senator (2007-present).

contact.office_address: 332 Dirksen Senate Office Building, Washington DC 20510

policy_positions.stance: Supports universal healthcare and Medicare-for-All-style reform.
Advocates progressive taxation and reducing income inequality.
Supports aggressive climate action and transition to clean energy.

bills_sponsored.title: Medicare for All Act
bills_sponsored.summary: A bill to establish universal healthcare coverage through a publicly financed system.

bills_sponsored.title: Raise the Wage Act
bills_sponsored.summary: A bill to raise the federal minimum wage to ensure a living wage for workers.

timeline.event: Elected to U.S. House of Representatives (1991-2007)
Gained national prominence during a presidential campaign; continued Senate work.
